basics.name: Rafael Oliveira
basics.title: PhD
basics.summary: My main goal is to apply my academic knowledge and industry experience to work in translational biomedical research (T0-T3) in the Pharma/Biotech Industry. I aim to develop Software as Medical Device (SaMD) solutions that function as Clinical Decision Support Systems (CDSS), using LLMs, Machine Learning and Computer Vision in the field of (radio)transcriptomics and Spatial Transcriptomics applied to Oncology.

work.name: Norwegian University of Science and Technology
work.summary: The doctoral research project (100% computational) I'm working in is centered around the stratification of patients (i.e. cancer subtyping, high risk groups for progression/metastasis, etc), and the identification of biomarkers and individuals who may or may not respond to diverse treatment strategies such as chemoradiotherapy and immune checkpoint inhibitors in the context of small-cell lung cancer (SCLC) using transcriptomics data (bulk, scRNA and spatial transcriptomics).

work.name: Artificial Intelligence Expert
work.summary: Temporary part-time position as a Bioinformatician & Software Development Manager in AI at a start-up to help with the development of an MVP that is capable of extracting ready to use insights from biomedical data. Developed a part of the MVP by integrating large language models (LLMs) and multi-agent systems (e.g., LangGraph, LangChain) with bioinformatics pipelines (e.g., RNASeq, DESeq, GSEA) on Azure Cloud. Implemented resource auto-scaling and conducted data engineering and feature selection to optimize these pipelines for machine learning algorithms.

work.name: BrandDelta
work.summary: BrandDelta's main goal is to offer solutions to businesses that want to turbocharge their insights and increase their market share using Artificial Intelligence.

references.name: Adrian Zety, Chief Project Officer & Bioinformatician at Artificial Intelligence Expert
references.reference: From the moment of the first interview, Rafael left me the impression of a very dedicated and professional programmer. He is a bioinformatician and AI specialist focused on learning the cutting-edge technologies available in the industry and a true believer in life-long learning. I had the pleasure of working with him in developing an MVP for a product that can change the way we do bioinformatics, and I must say that he always makes time in his heavy PhD schedule to work and improve his skills never giving up on presenting results in some of the most organized ways I've ever seen. I think anyone would find Rafael a great addition in their team, wherever it's a biomedical team or a more IT-focused solutions company.
